alert.note: Alert for Lake; Porter (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 27 at 4:32AM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Period of Accumulating Snow and Blowing Snow This Morning... A period of moderate to briefly heavy snow is expected this morning, likely reaching Rockford, DeKalb and Dixon areas prior to 8 AM, then east into the Chicago metro after 8 or 9 AM. The rather short duration of the heavier snow should result in only minor accumulations, up to an inch or so. However, south winds will increase to 20 to 30 mph with gusts of 30 to 40 mph later this morning. The strong winds combined with snow will result in sharply reduced visibilities and some blowing snow. Since untreated roads will likely become snow covered, anyone planning to drive this morning should leave extra travel time.
